test_cases.objective: To verify that the Environmental Monitoring System (EMS) continuously monitors temperature as per URS-EMS-001 and URS-EMS-002.

test_steps.action: Set up the EMS to monitor a test storage area.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS successfully initializes and begins monitoring.

test_steps.action: Record temperature readings at 5-minute intervals for 1 hour.
test_steps.expected_result: Temperature readings are recorded every 5 minutes without fail.

test_steps.action: Verify the accuracy of temperature readings using a calibrated thermometer.
test_steps.expected_result: Temperature readings are within ±0.5°C of the calibrated thermometer.

acceptance_criteria: Temperature readings are recorded every 5 minutes
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all temperature readings are recorded and stored securely

test_cases.objective: To validate that the EMS generates alerts when temperature deviates ±2°C from the setpoint as per URS-EMS-005.

test_steps.action: Set the temperature setpoint to 25°C in the EMS.
test_steps.expected_result: Setpoint is successfully configured in the EMS.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature deviation to 27.1°C.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS generates an alert indicating a temperature deviation.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature deviation to 22.9°C.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS generates an alert indicating a temperature deviation.

acceptance_criteria: Alerts are generated for deviations ±2°C from setpoint
Alerts are logged in the system
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all alerts are recorded and stored securely

test_cases.test_name: Environmental Monitoring System Temperature Accuracy Verification
test_cases.objective: Verify that the Environmental Monitoring System (EMS) accurately measures temperature within the specified range of -80°C to +50°C with an accuracy of ±0.5°C.

test_steps.action: Set the temperature reference device to -80°C and place it in the monitored area.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS displays temperature within -80.5°C to -79.5°C.

test_steps.action: Set the temperature reference device to +50°C and place it in the monitored area.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS displays temperature within +49.5°C to +50.5°C.

acceptance_criteria: EMS temperature readings must be within ±0.5°C of the reference device readings
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all temperature readings are stored in the vendor's standard database format

test_cases.objective: Verify that the EMS generates alerts when the temperature deviates ±2°C from the setpoint.

test_steps.action: Set the temperature setpoint to 25°C and allow the system to stabilize.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS displays temperature at 25°C.

test_steps.action: Increase the temperature to 27.1°C.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS generates an alert for temperature deviation.

test_steps.action: Decrease the temperature to 22.9°C.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS generates an alert for temperature deviation.

acceptance_criteria: EMS must generate alerts when temperature deviates ±2°C from the setpoint
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all alerts are logged in the vendor's standard database format

test_cases.objective: Verify that the Environmental Monitoring System accurately records temperature within the specified range of -80°C to +50°C with ±0.5°C accuracy.
prerequisites: Test environment prepared with controlled temperature conditions

test_steps.action: Set up the EMS in a controlled environment with a known temperature reference point.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS initializes correctly and displays current temperature reading.

test_steps.action: Gradually adjust the environment temperature across the range (-80°C to +50°C) in 10°C increments.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS continuously records temperature at each increment without interruption.

test_steps.action: Compare EMS readings with reference device measurements at each temperature point.
test_steps.expected_result: All EMS readings are within ±0.5°C of the reference values.
data_to_capture: Deviation between EMS and reference values

acceptance_criteria: EMS maintains continuous temperature monitoring throughout the test
All temperature readings are within ±0.5°C of reference values
System records data at intervals not exceeding 5 minutes
regulatory_basis: 21 CFR Part 11 compliance for electronic records
EU GMP Annex 11 for computerized systems
data_integrity_requirements: All temperature data must be complete and unaltered
Audit trail must record all temperature measurements
Data must be retained for 7 years per URS-EMS-010

test_cases.test_name: EMS Alert Generation and Notification Test
test_cases.objective: Verify that the EMS correctly generates alerts when temperature deviates ±2°C from setpoint and properly notifies designated personnel.
prerequisites: Notification system configured with test email accounts

test_steps.action: Configure EMS with test temperature setpoint of 5°C and alert threshold of ±2°C.
test_steps.expected_result: System accepts configuration changes and displays current settings.

test_steps.action: Gradually increase chamber temperature to trigger upper alert threshold (7°C).
test_steps.expected_result: EMS generates visual and audible alert when temperature reaches 7°C.

test_steps.action: Verify notification emails are sent to all configured recipients.
test_steps.expected_result: Test email accounts receive alert notifications within 2 minutes of threshold breach.

test_steps.action: Repeat test for lower threshold (3°C) by decreasing chamber temperature.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS generates appropriate alerts when temperature drops below lower threshold.

acceptance_criteria: Alarms trigger precisely at ±2°C from setpoint
All configured notification methods function correctly
Alert events are properly recorded in system audit trail
Notifications are delivered within specified time window
regulatory_basis: EU GMP Annex 11 for alarm management
FDA Guidance on Data Integrity and Compliance
data_integrity_requirements: All alert events must be recorded in audit trail
Notification records must be complete and unaltered
Alert thresholds must be protected from unauthorized changes

test_cases.objective: To verify that the Environmental Monitoring System (EMS) continuously monitors temperature in all GMP storage areas as specified in URS-EMS-001.

test_steps.action: Set temperature sensors in GMP storage areas to known values.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS displays correct temperature readings for each sensor.

test_steps.action: Monitor temperature readings over a 24-hour period.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS records temperature readings at intervals not exceeding 5 minutes as per URS-EMS-002.

data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all temperature data is stored accurately

test_cases.objective: To validate that the EMS generates alerts when temperature deviates ±2°C from the setpoint as specified in URS-EMS-005.

test_steps.action: Set temperature sensor to a known value within the acceptable range.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS displays the correct temperature reading.

test_steps.action: Adjust temperature to exceed the ±2°C threshold.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS generates an alert indicating temperature deviation.

acceptance_criteria: EMS generates alerts for temperature deviations
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all alerts are logged accurately

test_cases.test_name: Environmental Monitoring System Temperature Accuracy Verification
test_cases.objective: To verify that the Environmental Monitoring System (EMS) accurately measures temperature within the specified range of -80°C to +50°C with an accuracy of ±0.5°C.

test_steps.action: Set up temperature calibration equipment at -80°C.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS displays temperature within ±0.5°C of -80°C.

test_steps.action: Set up temperature calibration equipment at +50°C.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS displays temperature within ±0.5°C of +50°C.

acceptance_criteria: EMS temperature readings must be within ±0.5°C of calibration equipment readings at all tested temperatures.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all temperature readings are accurately recorded and stored.

test_cases.objective: To verify that the Environmental Monitoring System (EMS) generates alerts when temperature deviates ±2°C from the setpoint.

test_steps.action: Set temperature setpoint to 25°C.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS displays temperature setpoint as 25°C.

test_steps.action: Increase temperature to 27°C.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS generates an alert for temperature deviation.

test_steps.action: Decrease temperature to 23°C.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS generates an alert for temperature deviation.

acceptance_criteria: EMS must generate alerts when temperature deviates ±2°C from the setpoint.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all alerts are accurately recorded and stored.
